intro: Pleiotaxis angusterugosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pleiotaxis, is a unique member of the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. Its root system is fibrous and contributes to its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. This species is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
